Some thoughts in National Health Executive following our recent collaboration with the Social Market Foundation. Five themes tend to dominate public discussion about the NHS: money, clinical workforce, tech (including new medicines), malpractice and reorganisation. Yet, the evidence points to the critical role that management and leadership plays in all of them: value for money, making the best use of clinical staff whilst developing them, implementing new tech approaches, maintaining safe processes and ethical behaviour, and managing organisational change effectively. We found significant concerns about the quality of leadership in the NHS with 27% of managers saying their trust or other NHS workplace was not effectively led. If the NHS is to get through a very demanding period, focusing in on the quality of management and leadership is a very high priority. In fact, it's one of the key investments to deliver a fast return on investment in the form of better patient care. However, the current configuration of healthcare systems leads to lack of collaboration and lack of trust and goodwill. These issues, which affect healthcare culture and outcomes, are not deliberate. They have arisen insidiously. These systems now need conscious examination. We can do better and we need to. I discuss these issues in 'From Hurting to Healing - Delivering Love to Medicine and Healthcare' All comments and opinions on this topic are welcomed. Listening to each other is how change commences. #healthcareadministration #healthcareleadership #organisationalculture

Hospitals and health systems are increasingly turning to interim leadership as a strategic necessity, notes Brian Krehbiel in talking with Kelly Gooch of Becker's Healthcare. Organizations are finding they don't have the "bench strength" they've had in the past and so use interims to keep teams and initiatives moving forward, Brian says. Interims can also address some of the monumental challenges hospitals and health systems face today. Read the full article below. #interimleadership #healthcare
